name: Rémoulade
description: This tangy, well-spiced sauce starts with mayonnaise and ends with a horseradish kick. It comes together quickly and is the ideal accompaniment to Jared Austin’s Cajun shrimp boil. It’s also pretty tasty served with steamed or fried fish, crab cakes or fritto misto. A full batch of this recipe makes enough sauce for a 12-person seafood boil, so for everyday home cooking, make half a batch.
keywords: cayenne pepper, creole mustard, hot sauce, mayonnaise
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup prepared or finely grated horseradish
2 garlic cloves, finely grated or pounded
2 teaspoons lemon juice, plus more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Place all ingredients in a medium bowl, and stir to combine. Taste, and adjust seasoning with lemon juice and salt as needed. Cover, and refrigerate sauce until serving. Any remaining sauce can be covered and refrigerated for up to 3 days.
